thread.title: Sisters missing since 1985 found alive as mum held over kidnapping after 'fleeing abusive cheating husband'
thread.title_full: Sisters missing since 1985 found alive as mum held over kidnapping after 'fleeing abusive cheating husband'

author: Natalie Evans
title: Sisters missing since 1985 found alive as mum held over kidnapping after 'fleeing abusive cheating husband'
text:
News Sisters missing since 1985 found alive as mum held over kidnapping after 'fleeing abusive cheating husband' Elaine Yates fled with Kimberly, then aged four, and Kelly, aged 10 months, following an alleged custody dispute with her estranged husband Russell Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Dad's words after 'kidnapped daughters' are found after 30 YEARS Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A mother has been arrested on suspicion of kidnapping her two daughters more than 30 years ago. 
Elaine Yates fled with Kimberly, then aged four, and Kelly, aged 10 months, on August 26, 1985, police said. 
The girls were reported missing from their home in Warwick, Rhode Island, by their father Russell Yates, who was involved in an alleged custody battle with his estranged wife at the time. 
Elaine Yates, now 69, was found in Houston, Texas, on Tuesday and arrested , Rhode Island State Police confirmed. Read More Elaine Yates went missing with her daughters in 1985 (Photo: Splash News) 
She had been living under the alias 'Liana L. Waldberg', authorities said. 
Her daughters, now aged 35 and 32, were also found living in the Houston area with families of their own, the Providence Journal reported. 
The women have been interviewed but their current identities will not be released, police added. Kimberley Yates was four when she was abducted - shown before her disappearance and an age-progressed image (Photo: Splash News) Sister Kelly, shown aged 10 months at the time of her disappearance and how she might look as an adult (Photo: Splash News) 
Speaking after his daughters were found on Tuesday, Russell said: "I've always been trying to find my children. 
"And now, at least, it is up to them to get in touch with me." 
The family was traced after police received an anonymous tip on December 23, police said. Elaine Yates, now 69, was arrested on Tuesday 
Yates faces two counts of child snatching, but her former husband suggested he does not want to see her prosecuted. 
He told the Providence Journal: "That ain't gonna help her, me or anybody else at this point. I just want to see my kids." 
Yates allegedly abducted her children after discovering her husband was having an affair. 
Russell reportedly admitted he had hit his wife during an argument over his cheating, but claims she attacked him first, according to the Charley Project. Read More Anguish of Claudia Lawrence's mum as police scale down operation to find her murderer Father Russell Yates wants his daughters to get in touch 
He is believed to have taken his wife to an emergency room for treatment where staff suggested she go to a women's shelter in Massachusetts. 
Three weeks later, while bar owner Russell was at work, she allegedly fled with their daughters. 
He is believed to have returned home at 2am to find the house empty. 
Russell was awarded full custody of Kimberly and Kelly nearly three months later when Yates did not turn up to a court hearing to contest. 
A felony warrant was issued for Yates' arrest on November 16, 1988. 
Russell formally divorced Yates in 1996. Like us on Facebook
